summary: Email from TD Bank representative Nicolas Boutin to Gillian Seaman confirming that TD Bank has no accounts in Jeffrey Epstein's name or with Epstein as a signatory, in response to a grand jury subpoena. The email is marked confidential and requests confidential treatment.

persons.name: Nicolas Boutin
persons.role: TD Bank Representative / Law Firm Sender
persons.context: Sends the email confirming TD Bank has no accounts for Jeffrey Epstein, likely a legal or compliance officer at the bank or its law firm.

persons.name: Gillian P. Seaman
persons.role: Recipient of Email / Likely Government Attorney
persons.context: Addressed in the email regarding the grand jury subpoena to TD Bank, presumably a prosecutor or investigator handling the Epstein case.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The individual for whom TD Bank confirms it holds no accounts, central to the grand jury subpoena.

connections.description: Boutin (TD Bank/law firm) is communicating with Seaman (likely government attorney) in response to a legal subpoena regarding Epstein.
The grand jury subpoena sought information on Epstein's accounts at TD Bank, but the bank confirms no such relationship existed.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena to TD Bank
events.description: A grand jury issued a subpoena to TD Bank N.A. seeking information related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

events.title: TD Bank's Response to Subpoena
events.description: TD Bank, via Nicolas Boutin, responds confirming it has no accounts in Epstein's name or with Epstein as a signatory.

keyFacts: TD Bank confirmed it had no accounts in Jeffrey Epstein's name or with Epstein as a signatory as of November 2019.
The confirmation was in response to a grand jury subpoena dated October 3, 2019, indicating an active financial investigation into Epstein.
The communication is marked as confidential and requests confidential treatment, highlighting the sensitive nature of the investigation.
